refnamediv.refpurpose: The GLib Runtime type identification and management system

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The GType API is the foundation of the GObject system. It provides the facilities for registering and managing all fundamental data types, user-defined object and interface types. Before using any GType or GObject functions, g_type_init() must be called to initialize the type system.

For type creation and registration purposes, all types fall into one of two categories: static or dynamic. Static types are never loaded or unloaded at run-time as dynamic types may be. Static types are created with g_type_register_static() that gets type specific information passed in via a GTypeInfo structure. Dynamic types are created with g_type_register_dynamic() which takes a GTypePlugin structure instead. The remaining type information (the GTypeInfo structure) is retrieved during runtime through GTypePlugin and the g_type_plugin_*() API. These registration functions are usually called only once from a function whose only purpose is to return the type identifier for a specific class. Once the type (or class or interface) is registered, it may be instantiated, inherited, or implemented depending on exactly what sort of type it is. There is also a third registration function for registering fundamental types called g_type_register_fundamental() which requires both a GTypeInfo structure and a GTypeFundamentalInfo structure but it is seldom used since most fundamental types are predefined rather than user-defined.

refsect2.title: GType
refsect2.para: A numerical value which represents the unique identifier of a registered type.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_FUNDAMENTAL()
refsect2.para: Returns the fundamental type which is the ancestor of type. Fundamental types are types that serve as fundaments for the derived types, thus they are the roots of distinct inheritance hierarchies.

listitem.simpara: A GType value.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_FUNDAMENTAL_MAX
refsect2.para: An integer constant that represents the number of identifiers reserved for types that are assigned at compile-time.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_MAKE_FUNDAMENTAL()
refsect2.para: Returns the type ID for the fundamental type number x. Use g_type_fundamental_next() instead of this macro to create new fundamental types.

listitem.simpara: the fundamental type number.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_IS_ABSTRACT()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if type is an abstract type. An abstract type can not be instantiated and is normally used as an abstract base class for derived classes.

listitem.simpara: A GType value.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_IS_DERIVED()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if type is derived (or in object-oriented terminology: inherited) from another type (this holds true for all non-fundamental types).

listitem.simpara: A GType value.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_IS_FUNDAMENTAL()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if type is a fundamental type.

listitem.simpara: A GType value.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_IS_VALUE_TYPE()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if type is a value type which can be used for g_value_init().

listitem.simpara: A GType value.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_HAS_VALUE_TABLE()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if type has a GTypeValueTable.

listitem.simpara: A GType value.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_IS_CLASSED()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if type is a classed type.

listitem.simpara: A GType value.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_IS_INSTANTIATABLE()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if type can be instantiated. Instantiation is the process of creating an instance (object) of this type.

listitem.simpara: A GType value.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_IS_DERIVABLE()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if type is a derivable type. A derivable type can be used as the base class of a flat (single-level) class hierarchy.

listitem.simpara: A GType value.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_IS_DEEP_DERIVABLE()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if type is a deep derivable type. A deep derivable type can be used as the base class of a deep (multi-level) class hierarchy.

listitem.simpara: A GType value.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_IS_INTERFACE()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if type is an interface type. Interface types are types that provide pure APIs, the implementation of which is provided by another type (which is then said to conform to the interface). GLib interfaces are somewhat analogous to Java interfaces and C++ classes containing only pure virtual functions, with the difference that GType interfaces are not derivable (but see g_type_interface_add_prerequisite() for an alternative).

listitem.simpara: A GType value.

refsect2.title: struct GTypeInterface
refsect2.para: An opaque structure used as the base of all interface types.

refsect2.title: struct GTypeInstance
refsect2.para: An opaque structure used as the base of all type instances.

refsect2.title: struct GTypeClass
refsect2.para: An opaque structure used as the base of all classes.

refsect2.title: struct GTypeInfo
refsect2.para: This structure is used to provide the type system with the information required to initialize and destruct (finalize) a type's class and instances thereof. The initialized structure is passed to the g_type_register_static() function (or is copied into the provided GTypeInfo structure in the g_type_plugin_complete_type_info()). The type system will perform a deep copy of this structure, so it's memory does not need to be persistent across invocation of g_type_register_static().

listitem.simpara: Size of the class structure (required for interface, classed and instantiatable types).
Location of the base initialization function (optional).
Location of the base finalization function (optional).

Location of the class initialization function for classed and types. Location of the default vtable inititalization function for interface types. (optional) This function is used both to fill in virtual functions in the class or default vtable, and to do type-specific setup such as registering signals and object properties.
User-supplied data passed to the class init/finalize functions.
Size of the instance (object) structure (required for instantiatable types only).
Number of pre-allocated (cached) instances to reserve memory for (0 indicates no caching).
Location of the instance initialization function (optional, for instantiatable types only).
A GTypeValueTable function table for generic handling of GValues of this type (usually only useful for fundamental types).

refsect2.title: struct GTypeFundamentalInfo
refsect2.para: A structure that provides information to the type system which is used specifically for managing fundamental types.

refsect2.title: struct GInterfaceInfo
refsect2.para: A structure that provides information to the type system which is used specifically for managing interface types.

listitem.simpara: Location of the function that initializes the interface.
Location of the function that finalizes the interface.
Location of user data passed to the interface_init and interface_finalize functions (optional).

refsect2.title: struct GTypeValueTable
refsect2.para: The GTypeValueTable provides the functions required by the GValue implementation, to serve as a container for values of a type.

listitem.simpara:
Default initialize values contents by poking values directly into the value->data array. The data array of the GValue passed into this function was zero-filled with memset(), so no care has to be taken to free any old contents. E.g. for the implementation of a string value that may never be NULL, the implementation might look like:
{ value->data[0].v_pointer = g_strdup (""); }

A string format describing how to collect the contents of this value, bit-by-bit. Each character in the format represents an argument to be collected, the characters themselves indicate the type of the argument. Currently supported arguments are:
'i' - Integers. passed as collect_values[].v_int.
'l' - Longs. passed as collect_values[].v_long.
'd' - Doubles. passed as collect_values[].v_double.
'p' - Pointers. passed as collect_values[].v_pointer.
It should be noted, that for variable argument list construction, ANSI C promotes every type smaller than an integer to an int, and floats to doubles. So for collection of short int or char, 'i' needs to be used, and for collection of floats 'd'.

varlistentry.term: gchar* (*collect_value) (GValue *value, guint n_collect_values, GTypeCValue *collect_values, guint collect_flags)

listitem.simpara: Format description of the arguments to collect for lcopy_value, analogous to collect_format. Usually, lcopy_format string consists only of 'p's to provide lcopy_value() with pointers to storage locations.

varlistentry.term: gchar* (*lcopy_value) (const GValue *value, guint n_collect_values, GTypeCValue *collect_values, guint collect_flags)

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_FROM_INSTANCE()
refsect2.para:
Returns the type identifier from a given instance structure.
This macro should only be used in type implementations.

listitem.simpara: Location of a valid GTypeInstance structure.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_FROM_CLASS()
refsect2.para:
Returns the type identifier from a given class structure.
This macro should only be used in type implementations.

listitem.simpara: Location of a valid GTypeClass structure.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_FROM_INTERFACE()
refsect2.para:
Returns the type identifier from a given interface structure.
This macro should only be used in type implementations.

listitem.simpara: Location of a valid GTypeInterface structure.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_INSTANCE_GET_CLASS()
refsect2.para:
Returns the class structure of a given instance, casted to a specified anchestor type g_type of the instance.
This macro should only be used in type implementations.

listitem.simpara: Location of the GTypeInstance structure.
The anchestor type of the class to be returned.
The corresponding C type of g_type.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_INSTANCE_GET_INTERFACE()
refsect2.para:
Returns the interface structure for interface g_type of a given instance.
This macro should only be used in type implementations.

listitem.simpara: Location of the GTypeInstance structure.
The interface type to be returned.
The corresponding C type of g_type.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_INSTANCE_GET_PRIVATE()
refsect2.para: Gets the private structure for a particular type. The private structure must have been registered in the class_init function with g_type_class_add_private().
This macro should only be used in type implementations.

listitem.simpara: the instance of a type deriving from private_type.
the type identifying which private data to retrieve.
The C type for the private structure.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_CHECK_INSTANCE()
refsect2.para:
Returns TRUE if instance is a valid GTypeInstance structure, otherwise emits a warning and returns FALSE.
This macro should only be used in type implementations.

listitem.simpara: Location of a GTypeInstance structure.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_CHECK_INSTANCE_CAST()
refsect2.para: Checks that instance is an instance of the type identified by g_type and emits a warning if this is not the case. Returns instance casted to a pointer to c_type.
This macro should only be used in type implementations.

listitem.simpara: Location of a GTypeInstance structure.
The type to be returned.
The corresponding C type of g_type.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_CHECK_INSTANCE_TYPE()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if instance is an instance of the type identified by g_type. Otherwise emits a warning and returns FALSE.
This macro should only be used in type implementations.

listitem.simpara: Location of a GTypeInstance structure.
The type to be checked

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_CHECK_CLASS_CAST()
refsect2.para: Checks that g_class is a class structure of the type identified by g_type and emits a warning if this is not the case. Returns g_class casted to a pointer to c_type.
This macro should only be used in type implementations.

listitem.simpara: Location of a GTypeClass structure.
The type to be returned.
The corresponding C type of class structure of g_type.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_CHECK_CLASS_TYPE()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if g_class is a class structure of the type identified by g_type. Otherwise emits a warning and returns FALSE.
This macro should only be used in type implementations.

listitem.simpara: Location of a GTypeClass structure.
The type to be checked.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_CHECK_VALUE()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if value has been initialized to hold values of a value type.
This macro should only be used in type implementations.

listitem.simpara: a GValue

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_CHECK_VALUE_TYPE()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if value has been initialized to hold values of type g_type.
This macro should only be used in type implementations.

listitem.simpara: a GValue
The type to be checked.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_FLAG_RESERVED_ID_BIT
refsect2.para: A bit in the type number that's supposed to be left untouched.

refsect2.title: g_type_init ()
refsect2.para: Prior to any use of the type system, g_type_init() has to be called to initialize the type system and assorted other code portions (such as the various fundamental type implementations or the signal system).

refsect2.title: enum GTypeDebugFlags
refsect2.para: The GTypeDebugFlags enumeration values can be passed to g_type_init_with_debug_flags() to trigger debugging messages during runtime. Note that the messages can also be triggered by setting the GOBJECT_DEBUG environment variable to a ':'-separated list of "objects" and "signals".

listitem.simpara: Print no messages.
Print messages about object bookkeeping.
Print messages about signal emissions.

refsect2.title: g_type_init_with_debug_flags ()
refsect2.para: Similar to g_type_init(), but additionally sets debug flags.

listitem.simpara: Bitwise combination of GTypeDebugFlags values for debugging purposes.

refsect2.title: g_type_name ()
refsect2.para: Returns the unique name that is assigned to a type ID (this is the preferred method to find out whether a specific type has been registered for the passed in ID yet).

listitem.simpara: Type to return name for.
Static type name or NULL.

refsect2.title: g_type_qname ()
refsect2.para: Return the corresponding quark of the type IDs name.

listitem.simpara: Type to return quark of type name for.
The type names quark or 0.

refsect2.title: g_type_from_name ()
refsect2.para: Lookup the type ID from a given type name, returns 0 if no type has been registered under this name (this is the preferred method to find out by name whether a specific type has been registered yet).

listitem.simpara: Type name to lookup.
Corresponding type ID or 0.

refsect2.title: g_type_parent ()
refsect2.para: Return the direct parent type of the passed in type. If the passed in type has no parent, i.e. is a fundamental type, 0 is returned.

listitem.simpara: The derived type.
The parent type.

refsect2.title: g_type_depth ()
refsect2.para: Returns the length of the ancestry of the passed in type. This includes the type itself, so that e.g. a fundamental type has depth 1.

listitem.simpara: A GType value.
The depth of type.

refsect2.title: g_type_next_base ()
refsect2.para: Given a leaf_type and a root_type which is contained in its anchestry, return the type that root_type is the immediate parent of. In other words, this function determines the type that is derived directly from root_type which is also a base class of leaf_type. Given a root type and a leaf type, this function can be used to determine the types and order in which the leaf type is descended from the root type.

listitem.simpara: Descendant of root_type and the type to be returned.
Immediate parent of the returned type.
Immediate child of root_type and anchestor of leaf_type.

refsect2.title: g_type_is_a ()
refsect2.para: If is_a_type is a derivable type, check whether type is a descendant of is_a_type. If is_a_type is an interface, check whether type conforms to it.

listitem.simpara: Type to check anchestry for.
Possible anchestor of type or interface type could conform to.
TRUE if type is_a is_a_type holds true.

refsect2.title: g_type_class_ref ()
refsect2.para: Increments the reference count of the class structure belonging to type. This function will demand-create the class if it doesn't exist already.

listitem.simpara: Type ID of a classed type.
The GTypeClass structure for the given type ID.

refsect2.title: g_type_class_peek ()
refsect2.para: This function is essentially the same as g_type_class_ref(), except that the classes reference count isn't incremented. Therefore, this function may return NULL if the class of the type passed in does not currently exist (hasn't been referenced before).

listitem.simpara: Type ID of a classed type.
The GTypeClass structure for the given type ID or NULL if the class does not currently exist.

refsect2.title: g_type_class_peek_static ()
refsect2.para: A more efficient version of g_type_class_peek() which works only for static types.

listitem.simpara: Type ID of a classed type.
The GTypeClass structure for the given type ID or NULL if the class does not currently exist or is dynamically loaded.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: g_type_class_unref ()
refsect2.para: Decrements the reference count of the class structure being passed in. Once the last reference count of a class has been released, classes may be finalized by the type system, so further dereferencing of a class pointer after g_type_class_unref() are invalid.

listitem.simpara: The GTypeClass structure to unreference.

refsect2.title: g_type_class_peek_parent ()
refsect2.para:
This is a convenience function, often needed in class initializers. It essentially takes the immediate parent type of the class passed in, and returns the class structure thereof. Since derived classes hold a reference count on their parent classes as long as they are instantiated, the returned class will always exist. This function is essentially equivalent to:
g_type_class_peek (g_type_parent (G_TYPE_FROM_CLASS (g_class)));

listitem.simpara: The GTypeClass structure to retrieve the parent class for.
The parent class of g_class.

refsect2.title: g_type_class_add_private ()
refsect2.para: Registers a private structure for a instantiatable type; when an object is allocated, the private structures for the type and and all of its parent types are allocated sequentially in the same memory block as the public structures. This function should be called in the type's class_init() function. The private structure can be retrieved using the G_TYPE_INSTANCE_GET_PRIVATE() macro. The following example shows attaching a private structure MyObjectPrivate to an object MyObject defined in the standard GObject fashion.

listitem.simpara: class structure for an instantiatable type
size of private structure.

refsect2.title: g_type_interface_peek ()
refsect2.para: Returns the GTypeInterface structure of an interface to which the passed in class conforms.

listitem.simpara: A GTypeClass structure.
An interface ID which this class conforms to.
The GTypeInterface structure of iface_type, or NULL if the class is not instantiated.

refsect2.title: g_type_interface_peek_parent ()
refsect2.para: Returns the corresponding GTypeInterface structure of the parent type of the instance type to which g_iface belongs. This is useful when deriving the implementation of an interface from the parent type and then possibly overriding some methods.

listitem.simpara: A GTypeInterface structure.
The corresponding GTypeInterface structure of the parent type of the instance type to which g_iface belongs, or NULL if the parent type doesn't conform to the interface.

refsect2.title: g_type_default_interface_ref ()
refsect2.para: Increments the reference count for the interface type g_type, and returns the default interface vtable for the type.

If the type is not currently in use, then the default vtable for the type will be created and initalized by calling the base interface init and default vtable init functions for the type (the @base_init and class_init members of GTypeInfo). Calling g_type_default_interface_ref() is useful when you want to make sure that signals and properties for an interface have been installed.

listitem.simpara: an interface type
the default vtable for the interface; call g_type_default_interface_unref() when you are done using the interface.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: g_type_default_interface_peek ()
refsect2.para: If the interface type g_type is currently in use, returns its default interface vtable.

listitem.simpara: an interface type
the default vtable for the interface; or NULL if the type is not currently in use.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: g_type_default_interface_unref ()
refsect2.para: Decrements the reference count for the type corresponding to the interface default vtable g_iface. If the type is dynamic, then when no one is using the interface and all references have been released, the finalize function for the interface's default vtable (the class_finalize member of GTypeInfo) will be called.

listitem.simpara: the default vtable structure for a interface, as returned by g_type_default_interface_ref()

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: g_type_children ()
refsect2.para: Return a newly allocated and 0-terminated array of type IDs, listing the child types of type. The return value has to be g_free()ed after use.

listitem.simpara: The parent type.
Optional guint pointer to contain the number of child types.
Newly allocated and 0-terminated array of child types.

refsect2.title: g_type_interfaces ()
refsect2.para: Return a newly allocated and 0-terminated array of type IDs, listing the interface types that type conforms to. The return value has to be g_free()ed after use.

listitem.simpara: The type to list interface types for.
Optional guint pointer to contain the number of interface types.
Newly allocated and 0-terminated array of interface types.

refsect2.title: g_type_interface_prerequisites ()
refsect2.para: Returns the prerequisites of an interfaces type.

listitem.simpara: an interface type
location to return the number of prerequisites, or NULL
a newly-allocated zero-terminated array of GType containing the prerequisites of interface_type

refsect2.para: Since 2.2

refsect2.title: g_type_set_qdata ()
refsect2.para: Attaches arbitrary data to a type.

listitem.simpara: a GType
a GQuark id to identify the data
the data

refsect2.title: g_type_get_qdata ()
refsect2.para: Obtains data which has previously been attached to type with g_type_set_qdata().

listitem.simpara: a GType
a GQuark id to identify the data
the data, or NULL if no data was found

refsect2.title: g_type_query ()
refsect2.para: Queries the type system for information about a specific type. This function will fill in a user-provided structure to hold type-specific information. If an invalid GType is passed in, the type member of the GTypeQuery is 0. All members filled into the GTypeQuery structure should be considered constant and have to be left untouched.

listitem.simpara: the GType value of a static, classed type.
A user provided structure that is filled in with constant values upon success.

refsect2.title: struct GTypeQuery
refsect2.para: A structure holding information for a specific type. It is filled in by the g_type_query() function.

listitem.simpara: the GType value of the type.
the name of the type.
the size of the class structure.
the size of the instance structure.

refsect2.title: GBaseInitFunc ()
refsect2.para: A callback function used by the type system to do base initialization of the class structures of derived types. It is called as part of the initialization process of all derived classes and should reallocate or reset all dynamic class members copied over from the parent class. Therefore class members, e.g. strings, that are not sufficiently handled by a plain memory copy of the parent class into the derived class have to be altered. See GClassInitFunc() for a discussion of the class intialization process.

listitem.simpara: The GTypeClass structure to initialize.

refsect2.title: GBaseFinalizeFunc ()
refsect2.para: A callback function used by the type system to finalize those portions of a derived types class structure that were setup from the corresponding GBaseInitFunc() function. Class finalization basically works the inverse way in which class intialization is performed. See GClassInitFunc() for a discussion of the class intialization process.

listitem.simpara: The GTypeClass structure to finalize.

refsect2.title: GClassInitFunc ()

listitem.simpara: The GTypeClass structure to initialize.
The class_data member supplied via the GTypeInfo structure.

refsect2.title: GClassFinalizeFunc ()
refsect2.para: A callback function used by the type system to finalize a class. This function is rarely needed, as dynamically allocated class resources should be handled by GBaseInitFunc() and GBaseFinalizeFunc(). Also, specification of a GClassFinalizeFunc() in the GTypeInfo structure of a static type is invalid, because classes of static types will never be finalized (they are artificially kept alive when their reference count drops to zero).

listitem.simpara: The GTypeClass structure to finalize.
The class_data member supplied via the GTypeInfo structure.

refsect2.title: GInstanceInitFunc ()
refsect2.para: A callback function used by the type system to initialize a new instance of a type. This function initializes all instance members and allocates any resources required by it. Initialization of a derived instance involves calling all its parent types instance initializers, therefore the class member of the instance is altered during its initialization to always point to the class that belongs to the type the current initializer was introduced for.

listitem.simpara: The instance to initialize.
The class of the type the instance is created for.

refsect2.title: GInterfaceInitFunc ()
refsect2.para: A callback function used by the type system to initialize a new interface. This function should initialize all internal data and allocate any resources required by the interface.

listitem.simpara: The interface structure to initialize.
The class_data supplied via the GTypeInfo structure.

refsect2.title: GInterfaceFinalizeFunc ()
refsect2.para: A callback function used by the type system to finalize an interface. This function should destroy any internal data and release any resources allocated by the corresponding GInterfaceInitFunc() function.

listitem.simpara: The interface structure to finalize.
The class_data supplied via the GTypeInfo structure.

refsect2.title: GTypeClassCacheFunc ()
refsect2.para: A callback function which is called when the reference count of a class drops to zero. It may use g_type_class_ref() to prevent the class from being freed. You should not call g_type_class_unref() from a GTypeClassCacheFunc function to prevent infinite recursion, use g_type_class_unref_uncached() instead.
The functions have to check the class id passed in to figure whether they actually want to cache the class of this type, since all classes are routed through the same GTypeClassCacheFunc chain.

listitem.simpara: data that was given to the g_type_add_class_cache_func() call
The GTypeClass structure which is unreferenced
TRUE to stop further GTypeClassCacheFuncs from being called, FALSE to continue.

refsect2.title: enum GTypeFlags
refsect2.para: Bit masks used to check or determine characteristics of a type.

listitem.simpara: Indicates an abstract type. No instances can be created for an abstract type.
Indicates an abstract value type, i.e. a type that introduces a value table, but can't be used for g_value_init().

refsect2.title: enum GTypeFundamentalFlags
refsect2.para: Bit masks used to check or determine specific characteristics of a fundamental type.

listitem.simpara: Indicates a classed type.
Indicates an instantiable type (implies classed).
Indicates a flat derivable type.
Indicates a deep derivable type (implies derivable).

refsect2.title: g_type_register_static ()
refsect2.programlisting: GType g_type_register_static (GType parent_type, const gchar *type_name, const GTypeInfo *info, GTypeFlags flags);
refsect2.para: Registers type_name as the name of a new static type derived from parent_type. The type system uses the information contained in the GTypeInfo structure pointed to by info to manage the type and its instances (if not abstract). The value of flags determines the nature (e.g. abstract or not) of the type.

listitem.simpara: Type which this type will be derived from.
0-terminated string used as the name of the new type.
The GTypeInfo structure for this type.
Bitwise combination of GTypeFlags values.
The new type identifier.

refsect2.title: g_type_register_dynamic ()
refsect2.programlisting: GType g_type_register_dynamic (GType parent_type, const gchar *type_name, GTypePlugin *plugin, GTypeFlags flags);
refsect2.para: Registers type_name as the name of a new dynamic type derived from parent_type. The type system uses the information contained in the GTypePlugin structure pointed to by plugin to manage the type and its instances (if not abstract). The value of flags determines the nature (e.g. abstract or not) of the type.

listitem.simpara: Type which this type will be derived from.
0-terminated string used as the name of the new type.
The GTypePlugin structure to retrieve the GTypeInfo from.
Bitwise combination of GTypeFlags values.
The new type identifier or G_TYPE_INVALID if registration failed.

refsect2.title: g_type_register_fundamental ()
refsect2.programlisting: GType g_type_register_fundamental (GType type_id, const gchar *type_name, const GTypeInfo *info, const GTypeFundamentalInfo *finfo, GTypeFlags flags);
refsect2.para: Registers type_id as the predefined identifier and type_name as the name of a fundamental type. The type system uses the information contained in the GTypeInfo structure pointed to by info and the GTypeFundamentalInfo structure pointed to by finfo to manage the type and its instances. The value of flags determines additional characteristics of the fundamental type.

listitem.simpara: A predefined GTypeFundamentals value.
0-terminated string used as the name of the new type.
The GTypeInfo structure for this type.
The GTypeFundamentalInfo structure for this type.
Bitwise combination of GTypeFlags values.
The predefined type identifier.

refsect2.title: g_type_add_interface_static ()
refsect2.para: Adds the static interface_type to instantiable_type. The information contained in the GTypeInterfaceInfo structure pointed to by info is used to manage the relationship.

listitem.simpara: GType value of an instantiable type.
GType value of an interface type.
The GInterfaceInfo structure for this (instance_type, interface_type) combination.

refsect2.title: g_type_add_interface_dynamic ()
refsect2.para: Adds the dynamic interface_type to instantiable_type. The information contained in the GTypePlugin structure pointed to by plugin is used to manage the relationship.

listitem.simpara: the GType value of an instantiable type.
the GType value of an interface type.
the GTypePlugin structure to retrieve the GInterfaceInfo from.

refsect2.title: g_type_interface_add_prerequisite ()
refsect2.para: Adds prerequisite_type to the list of prerequisites of interface_type. This means that any type implementing interface_type must also implement prerequisite_type. Prerequisites can be thought of as an alternative to interface derivation (which GType doesn't support). An interface can have at most one instantiatable prerequisite type.

listitem.simpara: GType value of an interface type.
GType value of an interface or instantiatable type.

refsect2.title: g_type_get_plugin ()
refsect2.para: Returns the GTypePlugin structure for type or NULL if type does not have a GTypePlugin structure.

listitem.simpara: The GType to retrieve the plugin for.
The corresponding plugin if type is a dynamic type, NULL otherwise.

refsect2.title: g_type_interface_get_plugin ()
refsect2.para: Returns the GTypePlugin structure for the dynamic interface interface_type which has been added to instance_type, or NULL if interface_type has not been added to instance_type or does not have a GTypePlugin structure. See g_type_add_interface_dynamic().

listitem.simpara: the GType value of an instantiatable type.
the GType value of an interface type.
the GTypePlugin for the dynamic interface interface_type of instance_type.

refsect2.title: g_type_fundamental_next ()
refsect2.para: Returns the next free fundamental type id which can be used to register a new fundamental type with g_type_register_fundamental(). The returned type ID represents the highest currently registered fundamental type identifier.

listitem.simpara: The nextmost fundamental type ID to be registered, or 0 if the type system ran out of fundamental type IDs.

refsect2.title: g_type_fundamental ()
refsect2.para: Internal function, used to extract the fundamental type ID portion. use G_TYPE_FUNDAMENTAL() instead.

listitem.simpara: valid type ID
fundamental type ID

refsect2.title: g_type_create_instance ()
refsect2.para: Creates and initializes an instance of type if type is valid and can be instantiated. The type system only performs basic allocation and structure setups for instances, actual instance creation should happen through functions supplied by the type's fundamental type implementation. So use of g_type_create_instance() is reserved for implementators of fundamental types only. E.g. instances of the GObject hierarchy should be created via g_object_new() and never directly through g_type_create_instance() which doesn't handle things like singleton objects or object construction. Note: Do not use this function, unless you're implementing a fundamental type. Also language bindings should not use this function but g_object_new() instead.

listitem.simpara: An instantiatable type to create an instance for.
An allocated and initialized instance, subject to further treatment by the fundamental type implementation.

refsect2.title: g_type_free_instance ()
refsect2.para: Frees an instance of a type, returning it to the instance pool for the type, if there is one.
Like g_type_create_instance(), this function is reserved for implementors of fundamental types.

listitem.simpara: an instance of a type.

refsect2.title: g_type_add_class_cache_func ()
refsect2.para: Adds a GTypeClassCacheFunc to be called before the reference count of a class goes from one to zero. This can be used to prevent premature class destruction. All installed GTypeClassCacheFunc functions will be chained until one of them returns TRUE. The functions have to check the class id passed in to figure whether they actually want to cache the class of this type, since all classes are routed through the same GTypeClassCacheFunc chain.

listitem.simpara: data to be passed to cache_func
a GTypeClassCacheFunc

refsect2.title: g_type_remove_class_cache_func ()
refsect2.para: Removes a previously installed GTypeClassCacheFunc. The cache maintained by cache_func has to be empty when calling g_type_remove_class_cache_func() to avoid leaks.

listitem.simpara: data that was given when adding cache_func
a GTypeClassCacheFunc

refsect2.title: g_type_class_unref_uncached ()
refsect2.para: A variant of g_type_class_unref() for use in GTypeClassCacheFunc implementations. It unreferences a class without consulting the chain of GTypeClassCacheFuncs, avoiding the recursion which would occur otherwise.

listitem.simpara: The GTypeClass structure to unreference.

refsect2.title: g_type_add_interface_check ()
refsect2.para: Adds a function to be called after an interface vtable is initialized for any class. That is, after the interface_init member of GInterfaceInfo has been called.

This function is useful when you want to check an invariant that depends on the interfaces of a class. For instance, the implementation of GObject uses this facility to check that an object implements all of the properties that are defined on its interfaces.

listitem.simpara: data to pass to check_func
function to be called after each interface is initialized.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: g_type_remove_interface_check ()
refsect2.para: Removes an interface check function added with g_type_add_interface_check().

listitem.simpara: callback data passed to g_type_add_interface_check()
callback function passed to g_type_add_interface_check()

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: GTypeInterfaceCheckFunc ()
refsect2.para: A callback called after an interface vtable is initialized. See g_type_add_interface_check().

listitem.simpara: data passed to g_type_add_interface_check().
the interface that has been initialized

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: g_type_value_table_peek ()
refsect2.para: Returns the location of the GTypeValueTable associated with type. Note, this function should only be used from source code that implements or has internal knowledge of the implementation of type.

listitem.simpara: A GType value.
Location of the GTypeValueTable associated with type or NULL if there is no GTypeValueTable associated with type.

refsect2.title: G_DEFINE_TYPE()
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_DEFINE_TYPE(TN, t_n, T_P) G_DEFINE_TYPE_EXTENDED (TN, t_n, T_P, 0, {})
refsect2.para: A convenience macro for type implementations, which declares a class initialization function, an instance initialization function (see GTypeInfo for information about these) and a static variable named t_n_parent_class pointing to the parent class. Furthermore, it defines a *_get_type() function. See G_DEFINE_TYPE_EXTENDED() for an example.

listitem.simpara: The name of the new type, in Camel case.
The name of the new type, in lowercase, with words separated by '_'.
The GType of the parent type.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: G_DEFINE_TYPE_WITH_CODE()
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_DEFINE_TYPE_WITH_CODE(TN, t_n, T_P, _C_) G_DEFINE_TYPE_EXTENDED (TN, t_n, T_P, 0, _C_)
refsect2.para: A convenience macro for type implementations. Similar to G_DEFINE_TYPE(), but allows to insert custom code into the *_get_type() function, e.g. interface implementations via G_IMPLEMENT_INTERFACE(). See G_DEFINE_TYPE_EXTENDED() for an example.

listitem.simpara: The name of the new type, in Camel case.
The name of the new type in lowercase, with words separated by '_'.
The GType of the parent type.
Custom code that gets inserted in the *_get_type() function.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: G_DEFINE_ABSTRACT_TYPE()
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_DEFINE_ABSTRACT_TYPE(TN, t_n, T_P) G_DEFINE_TYPE_EXTENDED (TN, t_n, T_P, G_TYPE_FLAG_ABSTRACT, {})
refsect2.para: A convenience macro for type implementations. Similar to G_DEFINE_TYPE(), but defines an abstract type. See G_DEFINE_TYPE_EXTENDED() for an example.

listitem.simpara: The name of the new type, in Camel case.
The name of the new type, in lowercase, with words separated by '_'.
The GType of the parent type.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: G_DEFINE_ABSTRACT_TYPE_WITH_CODE()
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_DEFINE_ABSTRACT_TYPE_WITH_CODE(TN, t_n, T_P, _C_) G_DEFINE_TYPE_EXTENDED (TN, t_n, T_P, G_TYPE_FLAG_ABSTRACT, _C_)
refsect2.para: A convenience macro for type implementations. Similar to G_DEFINE_TYPE_WITH_CODE(), but defines an abstract type and allows to insert custom code into the *_get_type() function, e.g. interface implementations via G_IMPLEMENT_INTERFACE(). See G_DEFINE_TYPE_EXTENDED() for an example.

listitem.simpara: The name of the new type, in Camel case.
The name of the new type, in lowercase, with words separated by '_'.
The GType of the parent type.
Custom code that gets inserted in the @type_name_get_type() function.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: G_IMPLEMENT_INTERFACE()
refsect2.para: A convenience macro to ease interface addition in the _C_ section of G_DEFINE_TYPE_WITH_CODE() or G_DEFINE_ABSTRACT_TYPE_WITH_CODE(). See G_DEFINE_TYPE_EXTENDED() for an example.
Note that this macro can only be used together with the G_DEFINE_TYPE_* macros, since it depends on variable names from those macros.

listitem.simpara: The GType of the interface to add
The interface init function

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: G_DEFINE_TYPE_EXTENDED()
refsect2.para: The most general convenience macro for type implementations, on which G_DEFINE_TYPE(), etc are based.

listitem.simpara: The name of the new type, in Camel case.
The name of the new type, in lowercase, with words separated by '_'.
The GType of the parent type.
GTypeFlags to pass to g_type_register_static()
Custom code that gets inserted in the *_get_type() function.
